Version 2.0: Bug: Feature stops working after some time due to service workers. This has been resolved
Version 1.8: Resolves edge case bug when middle tab was closed.
Version 1.7: Feature request to accommodate if a recent tab was closed has been added.


Swap Tabs: Effortlessly Navigate Back to Your Last Tab!

Overview
Swap Tabs offers a seamless solution for quickly switching back to your previously active tab. Designed with productivity in mind, this extension is ideal for users who frequently work with multiple tabs open. Whether you're conducting quick research or need to reference different pages, Swap Tabs lets you navigate back to your last tab(not your adjacent tab) with ease, eliminating the need to divert your attention from your work to manually search for the correct tab.

Key Features
Simple Shortcut Utilization: Use intuitive keyboard shortcuts to swap tabs without disrupting your workflow. 

Customizable for Your Convenience: While the default shortcut on macOS is ALT-TAB, Swap Tabs can be personalized to suit your preferences. For Windows users, a recommended shortcut is ALT-Q, which can be easily set up via chrome://extensions/shortcuts.

Enhance Your Productivity: Ideal for power users, this tool significantly reduces time and stress associated with tab navigation, allowing for a smoother browsing experience.
